content: Airline passenger screening in the United States has evolved significantly since the 9/11 terrorist attacks, with new screening technologies and changes in policies overseen by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) created after 9/11. The TSA is mandated by the Aviation Transportation and Security Act (ATSA) to provide comprehensive security screening for all airline passengers and property, while also having the authority to implement trusted traveler programs and utilize technologies to expedite security.
